lead_paragraph: The reduction of penalties for certain drug and property crimes led to 52,000 fewer arrests last year and a 28 percent drop in felony arrests.

headline.print_headline: By Reducing Penalties, Voter Initiative Leads to Lowest Arrest Rate in California’s History
headline.main: California Crime Initiative Leads to Lowest Arrest Rate in State’s History

snippet: The reduction of penalties for certain drug and property crimes led to 52,000 fewer arrests last year and a 28 percent drop in felony arrests....
abstract: Experts contend California's Proposition 27, which lowered criminal penalties for certain drug and property crimes, making them misdemeanors instead of felonies, has resulted in lowest felony arrest rate in state history; initiative, approved in 2014, allowed police to overlook certain illegal pursuits; arrests in 2015 fell by 52,000 compared with 2014; law enforcement officials say it is too early to determine if Prop 27 changes are helping spur rising crime rates.
